title: 2014 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship qualification
text:
The qualifying tournaments to the <a href="2014%20CONCACAF%20Under-20%20Women%27s%20Championship">2014 CONCACAF Under-20 Women's Championship</a>, the North American continent's youth <a href="association%20football">football</a> championships started in July 2013. The qualification process was divided into the Central American and Caribbean zone. <a href="United%20States">USA</a> and <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, as well as hosts <a href="Cayman%20Islands">Cayman Islands</a>, were automatically qualified to the final tournament.
Central America qualifying.
Three teams will advance to the final tournament. The <a href="Central%20American%20Football%20Union">Central American Football Union</a> set the dates for the tournament on 9 July 2013.
Group 1.
Played from 21 to 25 August 2013 in <a href="Honduras">Honduras</a>.
Group 2.
Played from 4 to 8 September 2013 in <a href="Panama">Panama</a>.
Play-off.
The two second placed teams play two matches on 17 and September 21 to determine the last team qualifying.
Caribbean qualifying.
Two teams advanced to the final tournament.
First round.
The winner and runner-up from each group advance to the second round. There are at four groups with fifteen teams.
Group 1.
Played from 9 to 13 July 2013 in the <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican Republic</a>.
Group 2.
Played from 16 to 22 July 2013 in the <a href="British%20Virgin%20Islands">British Virgin Islands</a>.
Group 3.
Played from 16 to 20 July 2013 in <a href="Suriname">Suriname</a>.
Group 4.
Played from 21 to 28 July 2013.
Second round.
The second round is played in November in <a href="Jamaica">Jamaica</a>. The top two of each group advance to the semi-finals.
Knockout-stage.
Semi-finals.
Winners advance to final.
Final.
Both teams advance to the final tournament.
